sg.edu.cs2103aug2015_w13_2j

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • sg.edu.cs2103aug2015_w13_2j.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Task>

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Task>, java.lang.Cloneable
    The Task class encapsulates all the data that represents a task: for example the name, deadline etc. Also provides getter and setter methods to manipulate named built-in attributes.
    Author:
    Zhu Chunqi

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task()
        Zero parameter constructor that creates and initializes a new Task object and records the time of creation. Note that the Task object is invalid as no name has been set.

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor to create a new Task object and set the name as the string provided. Internally creates a new Task object and calls setName(String).
        Parameters:
        name - String name to give this Task object.

    • Method Detail

                     java.lang.String value)
        Sets the string value of the specified label of this Task object.
        Parameters:
        label - Label value to set.
        value - String value to set the label or null to unset the label.

      • setStart

        public void setStart(java.util.Date start)
        Sets the value of the "START" label of this Task object by converting the provided Date object into the string millisecond epoch.
        Parameters:
        start - Date value to set the "START" or null to unset the label.

      • setStart

        public void setStart(java.lang.String format)
        Sets the value of the "START" label of this Task object based on the current value of the "START" label as well as the provided format string. If the "START" label has been set previously, its value will be used as the base date from which the unspecified parts of the format string are derived. Otherwise, the current date and time will be used as the base date instead.
        Parameters:
        format - Format string of the form dd_MM_yyyy_HH_mm where one or more parts may be specified by user input.

      • getStart

        public java.util.Date getStart()
        Retrieves a Date representation of the "START" label of this Task object.
        Returns:
        Date representation of the "START" label.

      • setEnd

        public void setEnd(java.util.Date end)
        Sets the value of the "END" label of this Task object by converting the provided Date object into the string millisecond epoch.
        Parameters:
        start - Date value to set the "END" or null to unset the label.

      • setEnd

        public void setEnd(java.lang.String format)
        Sets the value of the "END" label of this Task object based on the current value of the "END" label as well as the provided format string. If the "END" label has been set previously, its value will be used as the base date from which the unspecified parts of the format string are derived. Otherwise, the current date and time will be used as the base date instead.
        Parameters:
        format - Format string of the form dd_MM_yyyy_HH_mm where one or more parts may be specified by user input.

      • isOverdue

        public boolean isOverdue()
        Checks if the Date value of the "END" label of this Task object has passed.
        Returns:
        True if the "END" label Date has passed, false otherwise.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
                throws InvalidTaskException
        Checks if this Task object is valid, i.e. its "NAME" label has been set with a string of non-zero length. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.
        Returns:
        True if this Task object is valid, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidTaskException - Thrown when this Task object is invalid, i.e. it does not have a non-zero length value set for its "NAME" label.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks if two Task objects are equal to each other. Specifically it is assumed that each Task object is created at a different point in time and their "CREATED" labels are compared for equality. If their "CREATED" labels the same then their "NAME" labels will be compared for equality.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        The hash code for this Task object is the hash code of the long value of the "CREATED" label.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Hash code of this Task object.

      • clone

        public Task clone()
        Creates and returns a deep copy of this Task object.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the provided Task object into its string representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of this Task object.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
        Converts and concatenates the provided list of Task objects into their string representation with blank lines as separator.
        Parameters:
        tasks - List of Task objects.
        Returns:
        String representation of the provided list of Task objects.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Task task)
        Comparison method used in Task sorting
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Task>

      • parseTask

        public static Task parseTask(java.lang.String taskString)
        Parses the provided string and attempts to reconstruct the original Task object.
        Parameters:
        taskString - String representation of a Task object.
        Returns:
        Reconstructed Task object.

      • parseTasks

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> parseTasks(java.lang.String tasksString)
                                            throws InvalidTaskException
        Parses a string containing multiple Task objects separated by empty lines into a list of Task objects.
        Parameters:
        tasksString - String representation of multiple Task objects.
        Returns:
        List of reconstructed Task objects.
        Throws:
        InvalidTaskException - Thrown when a reconstructed Task object is invalid, i.e. does not have a task name.
